content:
An Android and iOS ecommerce app that gives every user their own “store”, so they can sell their items and “shop their store”.
  This project is geared at people who want to sell off old clothes and those you don’t have the means to run their own website due to cost.
  This app was built with the Flutter SDK as the front end and Cloud Firestore as the backend.
summary:
An Android and iOS ecommerce app that gives every user their own “store”, so they can sell their items and “shop their store”.
  This project is geared at people who want to sell off old clothes and those you don’t have the means to run their own website due to cost.
  This app was built with the Flutter SDK as the front end and Cloud Firestore as the backend.
title: Shop Your Store

content:
What is Quiz Bowl?  Quiz Bowl is an academic competition in which two teams compete to answer questions from all areas of knowledge, including history, literature, science, fine arts, current events, pop culture, sports, and more.
   How does Quiz Bowl work? This video is from the NAQT, which is an organization that provides Quiz Bowl questions.
Questions are read by a moderator and players buzz in when they think they know the answer.
“Tossup” questions are questions that are to be answered individually, but once answered they lead to three “bonus” questions which can be answered as a team collectively.
Each tossup question is worth 10 points and if answered within the bolded section of the tossup question, the player is awarded an extra 5 points in addition to the 10 which is called a “power”.
Each bonus question is worth 10 points.
When do we meet? Due to coronavirus, we have been meeting online through Discord to conduct practice on Mondays from 5 - 7 PM.
How can I practice? There is this website called Protobowl, which many people in Quiz Bowl use to practice.
The NAQT has a game called Buzzword, which is an audio game you can play to improve your quiz bowl skills. There are sample games in the link provided, and if you would like, you can make an NAQT account to compete in some of their tournaments. The sample games are very similar to how real quiz bowl games will be read, so it would be good practice to try them or just to see how you feel playing Quiz Bowl.
Another resource is quizbowlpackets.com, which is website where many packets from prominent Quiz Bowl institutions are posted so that you can practice with them.
Here are some sample questions from each major category: History Monks in this country accidentally altered the dangerous confluence of three rivers when they built the Leshan Buddha. A tomb containing a mercury river and an army of (*)¬†Terracotta soldiers honors this country’s emperor Qin Shi Huangdi, who began building this nation’s defense against the Huns. For ten points, name this nation, home to a Great Wall.
ANSWER:¬†People’s Republic of China (accept Middle Kingdom; accept Zhongguo)
Science These objects can be formed when the Tolman-Oppenheimer-Volkovv limit is exceeded, which can cause a gravitational collapse within the Schwarzschild radius. Spaghettification can result from these objects' extreme (*) gravitational pull, which prevent light from escaping from them. For ten points, name these extremely dark objects in space.
ANSWER:¬†black holes
Fine Arts The guqin is a Chinese member of this instrument family, which also includes the bouzouki and an instrument sometimes played with hammers, the dulcimer. Zithers and (*) sitars are also members of this family, which are played by plucking or strumming. For ten points, name this family of instruments that includes guitars and violins.
ANSWER:¬†string instruments (accept chordophones; accept word forms; accept zither before mentioned)
Literature This character is introduced by Stamford, and discovers that the mysterious Red Headed League is a cover for a plot to rob a bank. This character apparently dies in a scuffle at the (*) Reichenbach Falls with his nemesis, Professor Moriarty. For ten points, name this detective created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, who resides at 221B Baker Street with John Watson.
ANSWER:¬†Sherlock Holmes (accept either underlined name)
Geography This location includes Homey Airport near Groom Lake, where Lockheed established “the Ranch” for engineers working on the U-2 within Nellis Air Force Range. The existence of this facility was admitted in 2013 by the (*) CIA. For ten points, name this secretive Nevada facility where the US Air Force probably tests experimental aircraft and probably doesn’t hold the alien remains from Roswell, New Mexico.
ANSWER:¬†Area 51
Mythology This man helped Atlas steal apples from the Hesperides and rerouted two rivers to clean the Augean stables. This man killed Hippolyta and stole her girdle, and at the request of Eurystheus, he used the (*) hydra’s own venom to kill it. As a baby, this hero defeated a pair of snakes sent by Hera. For ten points, identify this Greek who slew the Nemean lion as one of his twelve labors.
ANSWER:¬†Hercules (accept Hercules until “Greek” is read)
Trash On this show, Joyce tries to communicate with Will by chopping through the walls of her home. Barb Holland disappears at a party she attends with Nancy Wheeler on this show, in which a group of boys learn about the (*) Upside-Down from an Eggo-loving, psychokinetic girl named Eleven. For ten points, name this 1980s-nostalgia mystery show produced by Netflix.
ANSWER:¬†Stranger Things
When are the tournaments? Because of coronavirus, many of the planned competitions have been canceled, but there are some online tournaments that are going to available to join; some of which we will compete in.
Any questions? If you have any questions feel free to contact me or Ketan at
  akhil.peddikuppa@outlook.com
  ketan.pamurthy@tagmagnet.org
  Want to Join? Click this link to join the TAG Quiz Bowl Team Discord Server.
summary:
What is Quiz Bowl?  Quiz Bowl is an academic competition in which two teams compete to answer questions from all areas of knowledge, including history, literature, science, fine arts, current events, pop culture, sports, and more.
   How does Quiz Bowl work? This video is from the NAQT, which is an organization that provides Quiz Bowl questions.
Questions are read by a moderator and players buzz in when they think they know the answer.
title: Welcome to Quiz Bowl Team

App to aggregate internships and job openings for high school and college age students designed to decrease difficulty in the application process.
  Internships and jobs at an early age have been shown to increase a student’s success in their designated field.
  Built using Flutter SDK with Firebase Authentication for the authentication and Cloud Firestore for the Backend.
  Submitted to Congressional App Challenge under District TX-30 represented by Congresswoman Eddie Bernice Johnson and placed 2nd.
summary:
App to aggregate internships and job openings for high school and college age students designed to decrease difficulty in the application process.
  Internships and jobs at an early age have been shown to increase a student’s success in their designated field.
  Built using Flutter SDK with Firebase Authentication for the authentication and Cloud Firestore for the Backend.
  Submitted to Congressional App Challenge under District TX-30 represented by Congresswoman Eddie Bernice Johnson and placed 2nd.
title: Internshift

content:
With automation and especially automation in cars becoming more present in everyday life, it is important to know the concepts associated with the new technology that will one day be all around us.
Here are the levels of vehicle automation in 3 minutes.
Level 0: No Automation These vehicles are the normal everyday cars that are manually controlled and ones that you most likely own. Almost all cars available fall in this category.
Level 1: Driver Assistance Level 1 is the lowest automation level in vehicles. An example of level one automation in a vehicle would be the adaptive cruise control or lane assist in more modern cars. Examples of cars that have these features are a Toyota Corolla or maybe a Nissan Sentra.
Level 2: Partial Automation In this level, the vehicles can control both the steering wheel and accelerating or decelerating. They aren’t considered self driving because humans still have to sit in the front seat and are able to take control of the car at any time. Most cars in the United States that are accessible by mainstream consumers do not have an automation level higher than this. Examples of this technology in cars would be Tesla’s Autopilot or Cadillac’s Super Cruise Systems.
Level 3: Conditional Automation Level 3 vehicles have environmental detection and can make informed decisions for themselves, such as accelerating past a slow moving vehicle. They are defined by being able to drive themselves, although only under ideal conditions and with some limitations. Not being able to operate in these ideal conditions is the barrier for cars in this level. Cars like these cannot be found in the US, but in Germany Audi’s A8L will have Level 3 capabilities with a feature called Traffic Jam Pilot.
  Level 4: High Automation These vehicles can operate without human interaction except for entering a destination. Until legislation and infrastructure evolves, these vehicles can only operate within a certain area, which is usually an urban environment. The ability to operate in within a certain area is what keeps vehicles at Level 4. Most Level 4 vehicles are geared towards ride-sharing services, such as Waymo which has developed cars which level 4 capabilities.
  And Finally, Level 5: Full Automation Level 5 vehicles have full autonomous capabilities and can operate on their own. They likely will not have steering wheels or pedals for accelerating or braking. They will also be free from any geographic boundaries that Level 4 vehicles were constrained by and would be able to go anywhere and do anything an experienced human driver could do. There are no Level 5 vehicles available to the public as of right now, however testing is being done in several places around the world.
summary:
With automation and especially automation in cars becoming more present in everyday life, it is important to know the concepts associated with the new technology that will one day be all around us.
Here are the levels of vehicle automation in 3 minutes.
Level 0: No Automation These vehicles are the normal everyday cars that are manually controlled and ones that you most likely own. Almost all cars available fall in this category.
title: The Levels of Vehicle Automation in 3 Minutes

content:
DaVinci Resolve 17 is a video editing software that is FREE, used by professionals and packs many features that make it a great alternative to Adobe’s Creative Cloud or Apple’s Final Cut.
What is DaVinci Resolve? If you take a look at the main video-editing softwares used by professionals, you’re most likely going to see either Premiere Pro or Final Cut Pro X. Now to people who can’t spend upwards of $40/month or $300, or for those who do not own an Apple machine, this may not be a viable option. Enter, DaVinci Resolve. DaVinci Resolve is an NLE, or non-linear editing software, designed by BlackMagicDesign, a company that makes cameras and other filming equipment. DaVinci Resolve 17, the most recent version, has a free form editing timeline, pro color grading features, tracking, Fusion (which can be used for animation and VFX), and Fairlight, which is for audio editing. All of this comes in the form of one app. It’s great for beginner and freelance filmmakers.
System Requirements Another great thing about DaVinci is that it also happens to work a lot better on devices that have lower specs. My previous laptop had a dual core i7, 8 GB of RAM and an integrated GPU. For normal edits and transitions, the program worked fine. Only once I started getting into heavy animations and VFX that I experienced lagged, but that is considered to be normal as of course my machine wasn’t that specced up. What I would recommend for you to have (if what you are editing is 1080p) at least a quad core CPU, at least 8 GB of RAM, and a graphics card with at least 2 GB of VRAM. For 4K, you might want to bump the spec up to at least a 6 core CPU, 16 GB of RAM, and a graphics card with at least 4 GB of VRAM.
Studio Version Pricing and Download Link If you want the Studio Version then it will be $300, however, you can do a lot without paying that money. BlackMagic also doesn’t constantly ask you to upgrade. Click this to go to the download link for DaVinci Resolve 17 from BlackMagic’s website.
summary:
DaVinci Resolve 17 is a video editing software that is FREE, used by professionals and packs many features that make it a great alternative to Adobe’s Creative Cloud or Apple’s Final Cut.
What is DaVinci Resolve? If you take a look at the main video-editing softwares used by professionals, you’re most likely going to see either Premiere Pro or Final Cut Pro X. Now to people who can’t spend upwards of $40/month or $300, or for those who do not own an Apple machine, this may not be a viable option.
title: My Favorite Free AND Professional Video-Editing Program
